sub_title: Co-founder and Managing Director | TORWASH | Converting organic residue streams to fuels
summary:
Biomass expert with a demonstrated history of working in Research and Development (R&D) projects. Skilled in biomass conversion processes such as gasification, pyrolysis, torrefaction and hydrothermal treatment (TORWASH). Research and project leader with a background in Chemical Engineering. Responsible for scaling up the TORWASH technology.

My mission is to contribute with my knowledge in order to preserve our planet for generations to come. My passion is bringing people together to achieve this.

awards.title: Marina van Damme Grant
awards.description: The Marina van Damme Grant is awarded to successful former female students of the University of Twente. The grant is awarded by the Twente University Fund and has been made possible by a donation from Dr M.A. van Damme-Van Weele. Ms Van Damme obtained the first doctorate to be awarded by the former Twente Technical College (now the University of Twente) in 1965. The grant is intended to support the career advancement of talented and ambitious female alumni of the University of Twente and help them achieve new ambitions. The accompanying award consists of a sum of money (€9,000), a certificate and a work of art, created by Mohana van den Kroonenberg.

projects.title: F-CUBED
projects.description:
The objective of this project is to develop an advanced process concept for the hydrothermal conversion of a broad range of low quality biogenic residues to superior intermediate bioenergy carriers (IEC) with fuel characteristics suitable for balancing the power grid, and to produce transportation and heavy industry fuels.

The F-CUBED approach enables the overall validation of a feedstock-flexible process, able to deal with variable feed characteristics, such as size, composition and pumpability.

The core technology is the patented TORWASH hydrothermal treatment and will be scaled up from lab (TRL 3) to pilot scale (TRL 5) for these specific feedstocks.

projects.title: EnCore (Efficiente Cascadering en Opwerking Rioolslib voor Energie-Neutrale bedrijfsvoering
projects.description: ECN part of TNO has developed a patented technology called TORWASH®. During this project, a 50-L/h pilot plant has been commissioned and is operational at the wastewater treatment plant of Almere, The Netherlands. The goal is to reduce the volume of the sewage sludge waste stream, produce biogas from the liquid effluent and potentially recover phosphorus. This project is realized together with partners Paques, STOWA and Waterschap Zuiderzeeland.

profile_positions.description: Responsible for upscaling and commercialization of the TORWASH® technology. Coordination of the design, engineering, construction, commissioning and testing of a 0,5 ton/h demonstration plant (2-year project), PR, marketing and supply chain management.
profile_positions.title: Co-founder and Managing Director

profile_positions.description: Responsible for upscaling and commercialization of the TORWASH® technology, leading key projects, contact person for launching customers, writing project/research proposals for subsidized national and EU projects, setting up new collaborations, broadening network, advising on strategy and R&D of the research cluster.
profile_positions.title: Technical lead Biomass Upgrading to Fuels

company.name: ECN (Energy research Centre of the Netherlands)

profile_positions.description:
Involved as a researcher in two European projects, SECTOR and LogistEC, which both involve the production of high quality bio-energy carriers by utilizing torrefaction technology. Also responsible for a smaller project which aims at a better understanding of the physical, structural and chemical changes that biomass (constituents) undergoes during torrefaction, with a focus on lignin chemistry.
Tasks include: small scale batch to pilot scale continuous torrefaction tests, feedstock selection and evaluation, troubleshooting. 
Responsible for: Executing research projects, leading work packages, project management, writing and editing project reports/deliverables, internship coordination.
profile_positions.title: Researcher & Project Manager Biomass Upgrading

profile_positions.description: Through TMC involved als a researcher and consultant in biomass torrefaction projects.
profile_positions.title: Chemical Engineer (Research & Consultancy)

profile_positions.description:
The scope of this research project was to produce a renewable alternative for natural gas from biomass via gasification.
Tasks involve: scientific publications, giving presentations, visiting conferences, networking, supervising student projects, academic teaching, mentoring BSc and MSc students, responsible for organizing group meetings/presentations, responsible for organizing group trips/excursions/leisure time activities, responsible for project budget and project management.
profile_positions.title: PhD Researcher

profile_positions.description:
The aim of the project was to optimize the energy usage of a commercial charcoal production facility by combined charcoal and electricity generation. The project was realized in cooperation with CleanFuels (Enschede, NL), Carbo B.V. (Almelo, NL) and Ekoblok (Almelo, NL).
Tasks involved: communicating with the factory workers, organizing and planning of measurements (on-site), processing of measurement data.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description: The scope of this research was the development of carbon-based solid-acid catalysts to serve as a renewable alternative for sulphuric acid as catalyst in the organic peroxides production process.
profile_positions.title: Industrial Training/Internship

profile_positions.description: Responsible for organizing lists of purchases in the procurement department
profile_positions.title: Student (Intern)

volunteer_experiences.description: Together with two other members of the network we create the content of the new website. This entails a personal page for each of the current members and information about the grant, Mrs. van Damme and the network itself. The website is live since May 19th: www.marinavandammenetwerk.nl

volunteer_experiences.role: Workshop organizer and hostess for Girls Day / Guest lecturer
volunteer_experiences.description:
Girls Day is an initiative of VHTO to bring young girls in touch with science, technology and ICT. It is an annual national event and several companies or departments related to these topics are open on that day to receive girls of an age of 10-15. At ECN, there were several workshops and presentations organized, as well as a quiz where the girls participated in. 
The role as a guest lecturer is to: (1) help girls at an age of 13-16 orientate themselves on the different type of jobs and eventually help them decide on their study path and (2) raise awareness of gender stereotyping at primary schools since children already at a young age define career opportunities as male and female.

Twice per year the University of Twente organises a mentoring session (face-to-face or online) where students can discuss with professionals about their education, career path and decisions made along the way.
Greek Women in STEM have a mentoring programme where mentees get matched with mentors depending on the challenges they face and their career path.

When an employee at a company is an Emergency Response Officer (or in Dutch BHV) (s)he provides assistance in case of an emergency. (S)he knows, for example, the procedures to follow on building evacuation in case of fire or the necessary first aid that has to be provided until professional help arrives.

Boskalis and The Northsea Foundation in cooperation with the World Wide Fund organize a beach clean up tour each year in the month August. The beach clean up starts in Cadzand, Zeeland and ends on the island of Schiermonnikoog.

Student recruitment in Greece (Study exhibition in Athens and Thessaloniki) for the University of Twente. Presentation for student recruitment at the University of Patras and the TEI of Kavala, in Greece. The latter further led to a student exchange programme (Erasmus) contract between the two universities. Responsible for writing a testimonial for a study guide/brochure for Greek students.

This cause was related to Earth Hour, a WWF initiative aiming at raising awareness about the vulnerability of our planet and the need for a sustainable society and lifestyle. Responsible for informing people about WWF activities and encouraging them to actively participate in Earth Hour.
I was responsible for organizing the Beach Cleanup Tour participation of Jong-ECN. We collected waste from the beach from Callantsoog to Petten.
The Flash Mob was organized by organization Kadera in the city centre of Enschede. This was organized in order to draw attention to domestic violence issues.

Dancing school Helia participated in a fundraising event with dancing performances (bellydance and Persian dance) in co-operation with the Join4Energy Foundation. The aim was to raise awareness for metabolic disorders and to give the foundation more publicity.
Website translations from English/Dutch to Greek

For the 50-year anniversary of the Univerity of Twente many celebrations were organized on campus. One of them was "The experiment in the forest", where in various domes set up on campus different types of research and technologies were demonstrated in a fun way for pupils visiting from regional schools.

volunteer_experiences.role: Co-founder alumni association SPT research group
volunteer_experiences.description: The goal of the association is to stimulate contact between former and current members of the research group. It strives to encourage members to share knowledge and experiences gained during working life among its members. To stimulate this further, the alumni committee organizes activities every other year where alumni members get the chance to meet new members and catch up with old friends. The alumni can also tell about their work experience in short presentations. This could also facilitate, for example, the arrangement of company visits and internships for students.

KIVI Region East in Cooperation with the Technology Museum HEIM in Hengelo, arranges a special do-it-yourself afternoon for children (5-10 years old). The aim is to inspire children and to communicate the passion for technology.
Student recruitment in Greece (study exhibition in Athens and presentation at the University and TEI of Kozani).
Responsible for correct time registration of the relay runners at three checkpoints, providing first aid when necessary and assisting teams with optimal turn taking.
